nosotros.title: About us
nosotros.p1: We are a law firm specialized in business law, focused on the innovation and consolidation of companies. We provide legal services to boost and strengthen our clients’ ideas, aligned with their business model.
nosotros.p2: We offer comprehensive legal counsel with a 360° approach, based on legal instrumentation, structuring, and legal engineering. With over 11 years of experience, we have advised and consolidated companies across sectors such as finance, food industry, real estate, construction, hospitality, hydrocarbons, agriculture, and mining. Our corporate legal services include civil, commercial, corporate, contractual, labor, financial, industrial and intellectual property law, estate planning, and AML compliance.

mission.title: Mission
mission.text: We provide specialized corporate legal services to consolidate companies across different sectors with efficiency and professionalism. We apply legal engineering to address specific needs with strategic solutions.

vision.title: Vision
vision.text: To be a benchmark in corporate legal services, recognized for our ability to consolidate and strengthen companies. Through research, innovation, problem-solving, and adaptability to the business environment, we aim to contribute to our country’s economic and social development.

valores.title: OUR VALUES
valores.general: We highlight our commitment to integrity, professionalism, responsibility, and ethics in every legal service we provide.

confianza.title: TRUST
confianza.desc: We build legal certainty in every interaction, communicating clearly and delivering on our promises.

lealtad.title: LOYALTY
lealtad.desc: We act with genuine commitment to our clients and their goals, always protecting their interests.

honestidad.title: HONESTY
honestidad.desc: We are transparent and straightforward. We state what is viable and what is not, with sound reasoning and professional ethics.

responsabilidad.title: RESPONSIBILITY
responsabilidad.desc: We handle each matter with discipline, timely follow-up, and accountability at all times.

experiencia: General Director of RCCO Abogados, he holds a Law degree from the Instituto Tecnológico Superior de Sinaloa and a postgraduate degree in Law of Obligations and Contracts from Universidad Panamericana, Guadalajara Campus. His experience spans various areas such as commercial, corporate, civil, labor, and corporate law. His leadership within the firm enables him to provide comprehensive solutions to clients across diverse business sectors.

Law graduate from the Universidad Autónoma de Sinaloa, with more than 10 years of experience in industrial and intellectual property. He has collaborated across various sectors such as real estate, construction, hospitality, and services. In addition to being a partner at the firm, he currently serves as Chairman of the Board of Directors, a role that allows him to apply his strategic vision in both the legal and business spheres.

Law graduate from the Universidad Autónoma de Sinaloa, with more than 12 years of experience in the corporate field. He specializes in drafting and reviewing commercial company contracts, as well as advising on legal strategies. He is currently a Partner Attorney at the firm, where he contributes his extensive experience to high-impact legal decision-making for corporate clients.

Law graduate from the Autonomous University of Sinaloa, with a postgraduate degree in Obligations and Contracts Law from Universidad Panamericana. He has 10 years of experience advising companies, mainly in the communications, services, hospitality, construction, and finance sectors. In his role as Partner Attorney, he specializes in the financial sector and in compliance with anti–money laundering regulations.

Law graduate from the Universidad Autónoma de Sinaloa, currently pursuing a Master’s degree in Business Law at Universidad Anáhuac. As a Junior Attorney, she has worked in various areas of law, including civil, commercial, corporate, anti-money laundering compliance, and industrial property. Her multidisciplinary approach allows her to adapt to the legal needs of diverse sectors.

Law graduate from the Universidad Autónoma de Sinaloa, with a postgraduate degree in Mediation and Alternative Dispute Resolution from UNAM. She has over 10 years of experience, particularly in matters related to gender-based violence, health law, environmental law, and conciliation procedures. As an Attorney at the firm, she specializes in corporate, labor, and civil law, providing support to clients in complex situations.

servicios.title: Legal Services
servicios.placeholder: Select a service on the right to see the details here.

societario.title: Corporate Law
societario.summary: We design and optimize your company’s legal structure to protect shareholders, ensure corporate efficiency, and facilitate growth. Our services include advising on incorporation, spin-offs, mergers, transformations, dissolutions, and liquidations of companies. We also draft ordinary and extraordinary shareholders’ meeting minutes, stock certificates, and corporate books.
bullets: Incorporation, merger, spin-off, and transformation of companies
Issuance of share certificates and corporate books

mercantil.title: Commercial Law
mercantil.summary: We provide advice on business operations, litigation, and contracts, ensuring your transactions are backed by legal certainty. Our services in Commercial Law include: commercial litigation, unfair competition, antitrust practices, and the drafting of commercial contracts.

civil.title: Civil Law
civil.summary: Our Civil Law services cover a wide range of areas, including drafting, reviewing, and litigating contracts (lease, purchase-sale, service agreements, etc.); advising on the acquisition, disposal, and defense of movable and immovable property; debt management and payment claims; representation in tort and damages cases (civil liability); and guidance on wills, probate proceedings, and the division of estates (successions and inheritances).
bullets: Movable and real estate property matters

planeacion.title: Estate & Wealth Planning
planeacion.summary: We design legal strategies for the preservation and orderly transfer of assets, whether corporate or family-owned, ensuring their protection and continuity.

laboral.title: Employment Law for Businesses
laboral.summary: We design solid labor schemes that prevent employee conflicts and comply with current regulations. We advise on the drafting of employment contracts, internal regulations, and corporate policies; represent clients in labor conciliations and litigation; conduct audits to ensure regulatory compliance; and provide advice on termination processes, severance settlements, and training on new labor law provisions.
bullets: Employment contracts, internal policies, and bylaws

propiedad_industrial.title: Industrial & Intellectual Property
propiedad_industrial.summary: We register and defend trademarks, patents, and copyrights, safeguarding your company’s most valuable intangible assets.
bullets: Protection of innovations and creative works

fideicomisos.title: Trusts
fideicomisos.summary: We advise on the creation of trusts. We help entrepreneurs define trust terms, identify the parties (settlor, trustee, beneficiary), determine the assets or rights to be contributed, and ensure compliance with all applicable legal requirements. We also design tailored fiduciary structures to manage and protect assets with legal security and flexibility.
bullets: Definition of trust terms and parties

pld.title: Anti-Money Laundering (AML)
pld.summary: We implement legal policies and controls to comply with anti-money laundering regulations. Our services include drafting and implementing AML manuals and policies, staff training, advisory on reporting obligations, internal and external audits, client identification and verification processes, transactional monitoring systems, and guidance in responding to regulatory authorities.

due_diligence.title: Corporate Due Diligence
due_diligence.summary: Due Diligence is crucial as it provides a comprehensive view of a company’s or project’s legal, financial, and operational situation before making strategic decisions such as investments, acquisitions, mergers, or partnerships. It helps identify and quantify risks, contingencies, and hidden liabilities, enabling informed negotiations and structuring transactions to protect client interests. Without proper Due Diligence, one risks acquiring unforeseen problems that may lead to significant losses or legal disputes. It is an essential tool for strategic decision-making, minimizing risks, and ensuring the viability and success of operations.
bullets: Comprehensive legal, financial, and operational analysis
Support in mergers, acquisitions, and partnerships

sociedades_financieras.title: Creation of Financial Entities
sociedades_financieras.summary: We advise on the incorporation of financial companies (choosing the appropriate corporate type and fulfilling requirements), drafting bylaws, and managing filings with financial authorities such as the CNBV, Banco de México, and CONDUSEF to obtain permits. We also design corporate governance and internal control structures, ensure compliance with AML and counter-terrorism financing regulations, and assist in obtaining licenses to operate specific financial products. Additionally, we provide planning support and draft internal operation, credit, and risk manuals and policies.
bullets: Incorporation of SOFOM, SOFIPO, and fintech companies
Procedures before CNBV, Banxico, and CONDUSEF
Governance, internal control, and operational licenses

contratos_financieros.title: Financial Contracts
contratos_financieros.summary: Beyond drafting and reviewing credit, investment, and guarantee agreements, we also advise on negotiating contract terms, structuring complex financial operations, representing clients in disputes related to financial contracts, and training on the legal implications and risks of such agreements.
bullets: Negotiation and structuring of complex transactions

cumplimiento_regulatorio.title: Regulatory Compliance
cumplimiento_regulatorio.summary: We provide regulatory compliance services for companies, including risk-identification audits, design and implementation of programs with sector-specific manuals and policies, advisory on compliance with institutions such as PROFECO, IMSS, INFONAVIT, STPS, municipal authorities, and others; representation before authorities; staff training on obligations; continuous monitoring of legislative changes; and drafting of required reports and documentation.
bullets: Representation before authorities and legislative monitoring

privacy.title: Privacy Notice
privacy.subtitle: Based on the Federal Law on Protection of Personal Data Held by Private Parties
privacy.intro: Pursuant to Articles 15 and 16 of the Federal Law on Protection of Personal Data Held by Private Parties, we inform you that the company CUIDAMOS TU EMPRESA, S.C., makes this Privacy Notice available under the following terms:
privacy.responsable: CUIDAMOS TU EMPRESA, S.C. is a legal entity incorporated under Mexican law, responsible for processing, collecting, protecting, and preserving personal data, including sensitive, asset-related, and financial data. Its main purpose is consulting, advisory, planning, and administration in legal, accounting, tax, corporate, and real-estate areas for all types of companies and individuals, public, national, or foreign. Address for service of notifications: Calle Tacuba 302, Interior 2, Col. Playas del Sol, C.P. 82148, Mazatlán, Sinaloa.

i.title: I. Data that may be collected

ident.text: Identification and contact data of the data subject, including but not limited to:
items: Full name, company or legal name, nationality, CURP, RFC, age, gender, date and place of birth.
Address, phone numbers, email, handwritten signature, photograph, fingerprint, marital status, and occupation.

finanzas.text: Asset and/or financial data, such as:
items: Credit/debit card number, bank accounts, assets.
Account statements, payroll receipts, mortgage credit information (if applicable).

privacy.consentCallout: In accordance with applicable law, for asset or financial data we require your express consent.

consent.tacit: In accordance with applicable legislation, we will deem your consent tacitly granted for processing the personal data listed above. You may object at any time through the procedure described in section V (ARCO Rights).
consent.expressFinancial: For financial or asset-related data, your express consent is mandatory. When such data are collected by electronic means to acquire a product or service, the mere act of making the purchase will be understood as your consent to the terms of this Privacy Notice.

ii.title: II. Ways of obtaining the data
items: In writing.
Verbally.
Through internet or electronic forms.
Via telephone services.
Any other means permitted by law.
ii.origen: Information may be collected directly from the data subject or through third parties to offer, provide, and/or improve the products or services.

iii.title: III. Use of personal data
principales: To confirm identity, comply with legal requirements, and verify the information provided.
Billing management (including sending invoices) and collection follow-up; where applicable, integration into legal documents and transfer to authorities.
Any other purpose compatible or analogous to the above.
secundarias: Quality assessments of the products or services contracted.
Sending commercial information, services, or promotions.
iii.optoutNote: Refusal to use your data for secondary purposes will not be a reason to deny the products or services requested.

iv.title: IV. Limitations on use or disclosure
iv.text: We implement administrative, legal, and technological measures to protect your information. You may limit advertising by registering with PROFECO’s Public Registry to Avoid Advertising.

v.title: V. Means to exercise ARCO Rights
v.revocationNote: You may revoke your consent; however, in some cases we may not be able to address the request immediately due to legal obligations, and revocation could prevent us from providing the requested service or delivering the requested product.

items: Name of the data subject, address, and an alternative means to communicate the response.

requirements.timeline: A response will be issued within a maximum of 20 business days from receipt or from the date omissions are remedied; this period may be extended once for an equal period when circumstances justify it.

vi.title: VI. Data transfers
vi.text: Data are processed internally to create files and, where applicable, to draft contracts. Transfers may be carried out without consent as established by Article 37 of the Law:
bases: When the transfer is provided for by a law.
When necessary for medical prevention or diagnosis, the provision of healthcare, medical treatment, or the management of health services.

When carried out to controlling companies, subsidiaries, or affiliates under common control of the controller, or to a parent company or any company in the same group that operates under the same internal processes and policies.
When necessary by virtue of a contract concluded or to be concluded in the interest of the data subject between the controller and a third party.
When necessary or legally required to safeguard a public interest, or for the procurement or administration of justice.
When necessary for the recognition, exercise, or defense of a right in judicial proceedings.
When necessary for the maintenance or fulfillment of a legal relationship between the controller and the data subject.
